column4: I am having issues with XawTV. when I start it, it gives me a black screen which I cannot task switch out of
did you point it at the correct video device?
I have no idea how. I cant do a thing once it starts up and blacks out my screen
can you right-click on it to get a menu?
k, did you start it from the menu or terminal?
okay, try this them: go Applications->Accessories->Terminal  and in that terminal, type this:  killall xawtv
what about ctrl-alt-F1?
you should be able to get back to it with ctrl-alt-f7
alt-f4 is probably responsible for that, ctrl-alt-f4 should take you out of X
what tv card do you have?
what does lspci have to say about it?
xawtv is rather primitive
try it from a terminal, it will tell you why
hrm, try tvtime -h
you should get a bunch of options, should be one there for 'device'
are you sure it's the correct /dev?
sounds like it should work just fine... do you have your coax hooked up?
composite?
yeah, RCA plugs into the Composite (i know, i have the same card. ;) )
er, shouldn't need to edit xorg.conf, but i'm not too familiar with fglrx..
